column3: Incorporated @ryanofsky's feedback and rebased ([diff](https://gist.github.com/jamesob/6bd9721e11431d636fd2b9f6399a45ef)).
Concept ACK. Will review later.
Fixed Travis failures (unchecked `db_cxx.h` include, whitespace) and rebased.

Thanks for the review, @jnewbery. Typo fixed and rebased.
```diff
 $ diff -u <(git diff master...a540696) <(git diff master...2d15e9c)

--- /proc/self/fd/11    2018-04-02 11:30:04.855218939 -0400
+++ /proc/self/fd/12    2018-04-02 11:30:04.855218939 -0400
@@ -192,7 +192,7 @@
      Mode mode;
 diff --git a/src/qt/test/addressbooktests.cpp b/src/qt/test/addressbooktests.cpp
 new fi
reACK 2d15e9ce7d2ca4cc48ce0010e3c1c227a81f3b78
Rebased, conflicts from the #10244 merge resolved.

Rebased and addressed @jnewbery's feedback (thanks!):

- Reworked `getAddress` definition and calls to remove use of default params (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12830/commits/9db465201d46535a9030d052d858f0e5e2c6e796)
- Moved the `qt/test/util.cpp` makefile inclusion to the right commit (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12830/commits/82e8fce0366527fd9f7ab14c32567cf4ef323abd
utACK 41180ac. Good stuff!
Incorporated @jonasschnelli's good feedback about `tr()` usage. I've also recompiled the EN qt locale with `cd src/ && make translate` and have squashed that in.
utACK the change to editaddressdialog.cpp. Not sure about bitcoin_en.ts - is that something that usually gets changed in each commit, or just once before a release?

@jnewbery happy to revert the change to bitcoin_en.ts, but @jonasschnelli seemed to think it'd be best to squash them in. [The documentation on translation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/translation_process.md#writing-code-with-translations) also seems to suggest that the EN locale file should be changed in tandem with QT strings: \n\n> src/qt/locale/bitcoin_en.ts is treated
Reverted EN locale changes per @jonasschnelli's advice on IRC.
Any other feedback here?
utACK 5109fc4a9cb2cbd73c33197fb9129e1413ab051b
Would it be possible (or desirable) to include the label of the address that can't be added along with the raw address string in these error messages? Seems like this would provide more context.
Yeah, that's a good idea. Will add.
`would should`
Oops, fixed.
This list of optional arguments slightly scares me. How much diff would it be to remove the defaults and change all the places this is called to pass in nullptr?

unused?

```
qt/test/addressbooktests.cpp: In function ‘void {anonymous}::TestAddAddressesToSendBook()’:
qt/test/addressbooktests.cpp:109:24: warning: unused variable ‘addressTableModel’ [-Wunused-variable]
     AddressTableModel* addressTableModel = walletModel.getAddressTableModel();
                        ^
```

This line is added in the wrong commit (commit _Add tests for address book manipulation via EditAddressDialog_ instead of commit _Introduce qt/test/util with a generalized ConfirmMessage_). The intermediate commit fails linking.
There are ~9 replacements this'd entail, so not too bad. Willfix.
Good catch, thanks.
Thanks for spotting this.
forward declaration unused. Please remove
Good catch, thanks. Will spend some time figuring out a sensible `clang-tidy` config to catch this sort of stuff.

I guess with this, the new translation strings won't end up in the auto. generated translation source file?\nMaybe use the `tr().arg()` part twice above or use the `QT_TR_NOOP()` (http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtglobal.html#QT_TR_NOOP)?
Good catch, fixed.

commit: [tests] [qt] Add tests for address book manipulation via EditAddressDialog\n\nThis method is already defined on line 139 but without `const`. I think the non-const variant is actually better because it returns a non-const pointer. (While technically allowed, it feels wrong to me to return a non-const pointer to a member from a const method).

commit: [tests] [qt] Add tests for address book manipulation via EditAddressDialog\n\nnit: Any particular reason for this to be a lambda expression instead of a regular function in the anonymous namespace?
nit: Also could be a regular function.

commit: [tests] [qt] Add tests for address book manipulation via EditAddressDialog\n\nnit: camelCase vs snake_case of local variables in this function is inconsistent (`r_key_dest` vs `platformStyle`). I think snake_case is preferred for new code.
